item.title: 央行正在调转船头，但路径不明
item.description: 主要央行本周的决定让人们更清楚地看到大流行病时期货币政策的终结，但也凸显了回归 "正常 "之路的漫长，因为官员们现在正在探寻降息的终点，并管理大规模资产负债表的收尾工作。【原文：Decisions by major central banks this week brought the end of pandemic-era monetary policy into closer view, but also highlighted how long the road back to "normal" will be as officials now probe for the endpoint of interest rate cuts and manage the wind-down of massive balance sheets.】

item.title: 斯凯登律师事务所从奥尔山聘用冈萨雷斯-苏斯曼
item.description: 斯凯登律师事务所周四表示，在越来越多的投资者推动企业改变战略或更换高层管理人员之际，该公司聘请了一位资深律师来领导其股东参与和激进主义业务。【原文：Law firm Skadden on Thursday said it hired a veteran attorney to head its shareholder engagement and activism practice at a time more investors are pushing corporations to change strategy or replace top executives.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，礼来首席执行官称减肥药短缺 "很快 "将结束
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四援引该公司首席执行官大卫-里克斯（David Ricks）的采访报道，美国制药商礼来公司预计其减肥药大片将在未来几天内在美国正式摆脱短缺状态。【原文：U.S. drugmaker Eli Lilly expects its blockbuster weight-loss drug to officially come out of shortage in the United States in coming days, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing an interview with the company's CEO, David Ricks.】

item.title: 苹果要求美国法官驳回反垄断诉讼
item.description: 苹果公司周四要求美国法官驳回联邦和各州反垄断监管机构指控该公司非法垄断智能手机市场的诉讼，并称此案旨在对这款广受欢迎的智能手机进行 "司法重新设计"。【原文：Apple on Thursday asked a U.S. judge to dismiss federal and state antitrust regulators' lawsuit accusing the iPhone maker of illegally monopolizing the smartphone market, saying the case seeks "judicial redesign" of the popular smartphone.】

item.title: 英国央行降息助推英国市场回暖
item.description: 英国新政府在大选中取得压倒性胜利，英国央行将利率从 16 年来的高点下调，这让大投资者对被忽视的英国资产卷土重来更有信心。【原文：Big investors are growing more confident about a comeback for neglected UK assets, with the Bank of England's move to cut interest rates from a 16-year high burnishing the feel-good factor from the new British government's landslide election win.】

item.title: 赫斯股价创 20 个月来最大跌幅，原因是雪佛龙出售计划再次出现漫长拖延
item.description: 美国石油生产商赫斯公司（Hess）拟出售给雪佛龙公司（Chevron）的交易再次被长时间推迟，受此影响，该公司股价周四创下20个月来最大单日跌幅。【原文：Shares in U.S. oil producer Hess suffered their largest daily percentage drop in 20 months on Thursday on fallout from the lengthy new delay to its proposed sale to Chevron.】

item.title: 美国环保局向受乔利特炼油厂停产影响的中西部各州发放燃料豁免权
item.description: 美国环境保护局（EPA）周四发布了一项紧急豁免，以帮助缓解因伊利诺伊州乔利特埃克森美孚炼油厂停产而影响汽油供应的四个州的燃料短缺问题。【原文：The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) on Thursday issued an emergency waiver to help alleviate fuel shortages in four states where the supply of gasoline has been impacted by the shutdown of the Exxon Mobil Refinery in Joliet, Illinois.】

item.title: 大额消费降温，休闲车制造商感受今夏酷热
item.description: 全地形车（ATV）、游艇和其他休闲车制造商正面临着一个暗淡的夏天，因为在高利率的影响下，对大额消费的谨慎态度使大型休闲产品制造商的需求复苏希望破灭。【原文：Makers of ATVs, boats and other recreational vehicles are staring at a bleak summer as caution around big-ticket purchases amid high interest rates has dashed hopes of a demand recovery for big manufacturers of leisure products.】

item.title: IAG 终止收购欧洲航空公司的交易
item.description: 英国航空公司（British Airways）的所有者国际航空集团（IAG）周四表示，已终止收购欧洲航空公司（Air Europa）的交易，理由是目前的监管环境令人担忧。【原文：British Airways-owner IAG said on Thursday it has terminated its deal to acquire Air Europa, citing current regulatory environment concerns.】

item.title: 科技巨头七月市值因盈利忧虑而大幅下跌
item.description: 由于季度业绩令人失望以及对高估值的担忧，7 月份全球大型科技公司的市值大幅下降，促使投资者将注意力从人工智能领域转移。【原文：Global mega tech companies' market capitalisation dropped sharply in July, in response to disappointing quarterly results and concerns over high valuations, prompting investors to shift their focus away from the AI sector.】

item.title: CNN 前主播莱蒙就取消 X 交易起诉马斯克
item.description: 美国有线电视新闻网（CNN）前主播唐-莱蒙（Don Lemon）周四起诉埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk），称这位亿万富翁企业家在与 X 社交媒体平台的合作被搁置后拒绝向他支付报酬。【原文：Former CNN anchor Don Lemon sued Elon Musk on Thursday, saying that the billionaire entrepreneur refused to pay him after a partnership with the X social media platform got shelved.】

item.title: 美国 6 月建筑支出延续跌势
item.description: 由于较高的抵押贷款利率影响了独户住宅的建设，美国 6 月份的建筑支出意外下降，上个月的数据也被下调。【原文：U.S. construction spending unexpectedly fell in June and the prior month's data was revised lower as higher mortgage rates weighed on single-family homebuilding.】

item.title: 美国制造业指数降至八个月低点
item.description: 由于新订单下滑，衡量美国制造业活动的一项指标在 7 月份降至八个月来的最低点，但这很可能夸大了该行业的困境，因为工厂生产在第二季度大幅反弹。【原文：A measure of U.S. manufacturing activity dropped to an eight-month low in July amid a slump in new orders, but that likely exaggerates the industry's struggles as production at factories rebounded sharply in the second quarter.】

item.title: 3M 任命奥的斯高管 Maheshwari 为新任首席财务官
item.description: 工业巨头 3M 公司周四任命电梯制造商奥的斯全球高管 Anurag Maheshwari 为首席财务官，接替任职四年的 Monish Patolawala。【原文：Industrial giant 3M Co on Thursday appointed elevator maker Otis Worldwide executive Anurag Maheshwari as its chief financial officer, succeeding Monish Patolawala, who was in the role for four years.】

item.title: 第二季度销售额好于预期，Shake Shack 股价上涨
item.description: Shake Shack 第二季度同店销售额超出市场预期，股价大涨约 16%，原因是即使在美国超值餐饮竞争加剧的情况下，市场对其汉堡和鸡肉三明治的需求依然强劲。【原文：Shake Shack shares jumped around 16% after topping market expectations for second-quarter same-store sales, as demand for its burgers and chicken sandwiches stayed robust even as competition intensifies for value meals in the United States.】

item.title: 需求回暖，康明斯上调全年展望
item.description: 美国卡车发动机制造商康明斯公司（Cummins Inc）周四公布的第二季度业绩超出预期，并预计在发电市场需求的推动下收入利润率将有所提高，从而使其股价在早盘交易中上涨了 4.6%。【原文：U.S. truck engine maker Cummins Inc on Thursday beat second-quarter estimates and forecast improved revenue margins boosted by demand in the power generation market, sending its shares up 4.6% in early trading.】

item.title: 主要央行降息步伐加快
item.description: 全球降息周期正在加速，半数发达市场的央行已经开始放松政策，美国联邦储备委员会也将在 9 月份采取行动。【原文：The global rate cut cycle is picking up steam, with half of developed markets' central banks having begun easing, and the U.S. Federal Reserve setting up a move in September.】

item.title: 人工智能芯片制造商 Cerebras 秘密申请在美国上市
item.description: 人工智能芯片制造商 Cerebras Systems 周四表示，它已秘密申请在美国进行首次公开募股。【原文：Artificial intelligence chipmaker Cerebras Systems said on Thursday it had confidentially filed for an initial public offering in the United States.】

item.title: 欧盟就排他性滥用反垄断指南草案征求反馈意见
item.description: 欧盟委员会周四表示，它已启动公众咨询，邀请所有有关各方就关于排他性滥用支配地位的准则草案发表意见，其中包括掠夺性定价、利润挤压、排他性交易和拒绝供应。【原文：The European Commission said on Thursday it had launched a public consultation inviting all interested parties to comment on draft guidelines on exclusionary abuses of dominance, which include predatory pricing, margin squeeze, exclusive dealing and refusal to supply.】

item.title: 凯拉诺瓦上调 2024 年预测，因北美零食需求稳定
item.description: 凯兰诺瓦公司周四上调了年度有机产品销售和利润预期，原因是尽管价格上涨，但消费者仍选择其早餐谷物食品和 Pringles 等即食零食。【原文：Kellanova raised its annual organic sales and profit forecasts on Thursday as consumers opted for its breakfast cereals and ready-to-eat snacks such as Pringles despite higher prices.】

item.title: 美国第二季度工人生产率加速提高，劳动力成本趋于稳定
item.description: 第二季度美国工人生产率增长加快，抑制了劳动力成本的增长，使通胀前景进一步明朗。【原文：U.S. worker productivity growth accelerated in the second quarter, keeping the increase in labor costs in check, and further brightening the inflation outlook.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数升至11个月新高
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济金的美国人数增至 11 个月以来的新高，表明劳动力市场有所疲软，尽管每年的这个时候申请失业救济金的人数往往不稳定。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits increased to an 11-month high last week, suggesting some softening in the labor market, though claims tend to be volatile around this time of the year.】

item.title: 因湿疹和眼部治疗需求强劲，Regeneron 季度业绩超预期
item.description: 受湿疹和眼科畅销药需求强劲的推动，制药商 Regeneron Pharmaceuticals 周四公布的第二季度营收和利润均超出预期。【原文：Drugmaker Regeneron Pharmaceuticals exceeded estimates for second-quarter revenue and profit on Thursday, driven by strong demand for its top-selling eczema and eye drugs.】

item.title: 迪士尼、福克斯、华纳体育流媒体公司 Venu 的定价为每月 42.99 美元
item.description: 由华特-迪斯尼、福克斯和华纳兄弟发现公司共同组建的体育流媒体服务公司 Venu Sports 周四表示，该公司将以每月 42.99 美元的价格提供为期七天的免费试用服务。【原文：Venu Sports, the sports-streaming service formed by Walt Disney , Fox and Warner Bros Discovery , will be priced at $42.99 per month with a seven-day free trial, it said on Thursday.】

item.title: 支出增加导致多米尼克能源公司第二季度利润下降
item.description: 周四，多米尼克能源公司（Dominion Energy）公布第二季度利润下降，原因是较高的利息和维护成本拖累了这家电力公司。【原文：Dominion Energy posted a fall in second-quarter profit on Thursday, as higher interest and maintenance costs weighed on the electric utility.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，埃利奥特向星巴克提出的和解方案允许首席执行官继续担任最高职位
item.description: 据 CNBC 周四报道，埃利奥特管理公司（Elliott Management）提出了与星巴克的和解方案，包括扩大董事会和改善治理，同时允许首席执行官拉克斯曼-纳拉西汉（Laxman Narasimhan）继续留任。【原文：Elliott Management proposed a settlement with Starbucks that would involve a board expansion and governance improvements, while allowing CEO Laxman Narasimhan to keep his job, CNBC reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国提议禁止航空公司收取家庭座位费
item.description: 美国运输部周四表示，它正在提议禁止美国和外国航空公司在订票时如果有相邻座位，则不得向有年幼子女的家庭收取费用。【原文：The U.S. Department of Transportation said on Thursday it is proposing barring U.S. and foreign airlines from charging fees to seat families with young children together on a flight if adjacent seats are available during booking.】

item.title: 美国海军造船厂亨廷顿-英格尔斯公司第二季度业绩超出预期
item.description: Huntington Ingalls on Thursday reported better-than-expected second-quarter results, as heightened global tensions drove up demand for aircraft carriers, amphibious assault ships and submarines.

item.title: 成熟内容吸引更多付费玩家，Roblox 提高预订预期
item.description: Roblox 周四上调了年度预订额预期，原因是暑假期间该平台的用户参与度有所提高，更成熟的内容有助于吸引消费能力更强的老年用户。【原文：Roblox raised its annual bookings forecast on Thursday, as user engagement increased on its platform during the summer holidays and more mature content helped it draw older users with higher spending power.】

item.title: 美国进步人士推动英伟达反垄断调查
item.description: 美国进步团体和民主党参议员伊丽莎白-沃伦（Elizabeth Warren）向司法部施压，要求调查 Nvidia 公司的竞争问题，理由是该公司在推动人工智能蓬勃发展的芯片市场占据主导地位。【原文：U.S. progressive groups and Democratic Senator Elizabeth Warren pressed the Department of Justice to investigate Nvidia over competition concerns, citing the company's dominance of the market for the chips driving the artificial-intelligence boom.】
